page.title: 17SURVEY ON MOVEMENT
page.content: FROM A RECENT SURVEY ON MOVEMENT WE OBTAINED THE FOLLOWING RESULTS: 40% OF THE PEOPLE IN NORTH GLENROTHES PREVIOUSLY CAME FROM FIFE. 20% CAME FROM WEST SCOTLAND, 16% FROM ENGLAND AND WALES, 12% FROM SOUTH SCOTLAND AND NO-ONE MOVED TO GLENROTHES FROM ABROAD. OVER HALF OF THE PEOPLE ASKED MOVED TO GLENROTHES BECAUSE OF JOB TRANSFER. THE OTHER HALF BECAUSE OF MARRIAGE AND HOUSING. 60% SAID GLENROTHES HAD CHANGED SINCE THEIR ARRIVAL,40% SAID NO.THOSE WHO SAID YES HAD LIVED IN GLENROTHES FOR AN AVERAGE OF 7.5 YEARS. FOR THOSE WHO SAID NO THE AVERAGE IS 3 YEARS. OF THE FINAL QUESTION, 84% SAID NORTH GLENROTHES WAS A BETTER AREA THAN THEIR PREVIOUS AREA. 12% SAID IT WAS WORSE, 4% SAID IT WAS JUST AS GOOD.
